p: In 2019, more than 100 countries were endemic for DENV and 87 had evidence of autochthonous transmission of ZIKV [ 4]. Brazil is currently the nation with the highest report of DENV [ 5] and ZIKV infections in the world [ 4]. There, Aedes aegypti is the only species proven to be involved in the transmission of these viruses [ 5â€“ 7]. Consequently, epidemics affect mainly Brazilian urban areas, due to the adaptation of the vector to this environment [ 7].
